alert.note: Alert for Gilpin; Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 22 at 3:09PM MDT until June 22 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in central Colorado, Gilpin. In northeast Colorado, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 615 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 309 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southwestern Denver, Lakewood, western Arvada, western Wheat Ridge, Golden, Evergreen, Morrison, Idledale, Red Rocks Park, White Ranch Open Space, Kittredge, Indian Hills, Bergen Park, Tiny Town, Rocky Flats, Genesee, Pleasant View, Wah Keeney Park and Ken Caryl.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, highways and underpasses. Additionally, country roads, farmlands along the banks of creeks, and other low lying areas are subject to flooding.
